experiments1.stimuli: accept free electrons
accept free electrons
Hi! You are done with the testing session. The actual trial will start after you press 'next' :).
mechanical energy into AC electrical power
operate on either an AC or DC
reciprocal of impedance
A device that converts a radiated electromagnetic wave into an electrical wave.
A component that changes the amplitude of a signal between input and output.
Spring clip on the end of a test lead used to make a temporary connection.
What is alternating current? An electric current that rises to a maximum in one direction, falls back to zero and then rises to a maximum in the opposite direction and then repeats.
What is analog? Information represented as continuously varying voltage or current rather than in discrete levels as opposed to digital data varying between two discrete levels.
What is AC generator? Device used to transform mechanical energy into AC electrical power.
languages express every noun with a certain grammatical
convert chemical energy to electrical energy
reciprocal of impedance and is measured
Condition that occurs when a bridge circuit is adjusted to produce a zero output.
An external signal is required to change the output from one state to the other.
Admittance is the reciprocal of impedance and is measured in siemens.
What is AC load line? A graph representing all possible combinations of AC output voltage and currentfor an amplifier.

What is band-pass filter? A tuned circuit designed to pass a band of frequencies between a lower cut-off frequency (f1) and a higher cut-off frequency (f2). Frequencies above and below the pass band are heavily attenuated.
What is bistable multivibrator? A multi vibrator with two stable states. An external signal is required to change the output from one state to the other. Also called a latch.

What is AC load line? A graph representing all possible combinations of AC output voltage and currentfor an amplifier.

What is band-pass filter? A tuned circuit designed to pass a band of frequencies between a lower cut-off frequency (f1) and a higher cut-off frequency (f2). Frequencies above and below the pass band are heavily attenuated.
What is bistable multivibrator? A multi vibrator with two stable states. An external signal is required to change the output from one state to the other. Also called a latch.

reciprocal of impedance and is measured
Condition that occurs when a bridge circuit is adjusted to produce a zero output.
An external signal is required to change the output from one state to the other.
Admittance is the reciprocal of impedance and is measured in siemens.

What is analog? Information represented as continuously varying voltage or current rather than in discrete levels as opposed to digital data varying between two discrete levels.
What is AC generator? Device used to transform mechanical energy into AC electrical power.
What is alternating current? An electric current that rises to a maximum in one direction, falls back to zero and then rises to a maximum in the opposite direction and then repeats.
